frameDefinitions: A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
An Agent has access to a finite amount of some Resource and uses it in some way to complete a Purpose.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
This frame describes a situation in which an Owner loses his or her Possession.
frameExamples: Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
We are <t>renting</t> our apartment from a kind man named Tom.
This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
I <t>used</t> half of the bag of dirt to plant the roses.
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The individual that gains temporary use of the <fen>Goods</fen> by paying the <fen>Lessor</fen>
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is an item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
The location the renting takes place.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The person who depletes a Resource to achieve some Goal
The exhaustible commodity that the <fen>Agent</fen> has access to.
What the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to achieve by using the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The amount of the <fen>Resource</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> uses to achieve the <fen>Purpose</fen>.
A more specific description of how the <fen>Purpose</fen> is achieved by spending the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Resource</fen> is used.
The physical location where the <fen>Resource</fen> is used.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The original <fen>Owner</fen> of the <fen>Possession</fen>.
The object that is possessed by the <fen>Owner</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Possession</fen> is lost.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Possession</fen> is lost.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
<fex>We</fex> 've been renting from him for years .
I rented the car <fex>right next to the airport</fex> .
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.

the months of April and May 1679

the Micmacs of the Gaspé Peninsula the Nouvelle Relation
L'expédition de Cavelier de la Salle dans le golfe du Mexique
dans Centenaire de l'histoire du Canada de F.-X. Garneau
